newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian ok for total foreign equity in power plant.
newsitem.headline: Indian ok for total foreign equity in power plant.

text.p: The Indian cabinet on Tuesday approved a proposal to set up a $787 million power plant with 100 percent foreign equity in eastern India, a government statement said.
The cabinet approved foreign equity amounting to $236 million in the Kalinga Power Corporation Ltd which plans to set up a thermal power project in the state of Orissa, it said.

The project will be set up by Public Power International Ltd, which will hold $87.4 million in equity and the rest of the equity will be privately placed among other foreign investors, the statement said.
The total cost of the 500-megawatt power plant, to be built in the town of Duburi, is estimated at $787 million and includes a debt component of $551 million, it said.
